title: On Discrete Curvatures of Trees
abstract:
There are several interweaving notions of discrete curvature on graphs. Many
approaches utilize the optimal transportation metric on its probability simplex
or the distance matrix of the graph. Since each of these ingredients is well
understood when the underlying graph is a tree, in this note, we review
existing and obtain new formulas for three different types of curvature on
graphs. Along the way we obtain: a comparison result for the curvatures under
consideration, a degree-diameter theorem for trees, and a combinatorial
identity for certain sums of distances on trees.
